overview:
Steve Repetti has more than 20 year’s experience as an executive, investor, software developer, and technologist in the computer industry. He is the author of the highly acclaimed social aggregator Scrapplet, award-winning social network site Zude, Web 2.0 browser library xWinLib, and co-wrote the FGL/open5G open source programming language/web server/object database.

Steve is currently the CEO/CTO of RadWeb Technologies, a hybrid technology development/investment firm currently focused on Social Media, Gaming, Enterprise, Healthcare, and Financial Services markets.

Steve is also Chairman of the Board of the non-profit International Data Portability organization, whose members include Facebook, MySpace, Google, and Microsoft. Additionally, he is a member of the OpenAjax Alliance and the OpenWeb Foundation. He is a frequent speaker on topics related to advanced technology, Web 2.0, open source, data portability, and the real-time web, and has published a number of articles in technology-related publications.

Steve loves to code.
